paragraphs.text:
%md

# Apache Zeppelin tutorial

This notebook shows how to use Apache zeppelin in RADAnalytics.io. 

In the board in the right, you will see the code to connect to your Spark Master. **NOTE:** Make sure you change the master URL to the one you are running in your OpenShift project.

msg.data:
Apache Zeppelin tutorial

This notebook shows how to use Apache zeppelin in RADAnalytics.io.

In the board in the right, you will see the code to connect to your Spark Master. NOTE: Make sure you change the master URL to the one you are running in your OpenShift project.

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

import os
import pyspark
from pyspark.context import SparkContext
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from operator import add

### CHANGE THE MASTER URL TO THE MASTER URL RUNNING IN YOUR PROJECT ###
spark = SparkSession.builder.master("spark://sparky:7077").getOrCreate()

%md

# Word Cound Example

In the board on the left we run the Word Count example, which will get the Zeppelin README.md file and will count the number of each words contained in this doc.

msg.data:
Word Cound Example

In the board on the left we run the Word Count example, which will get the Zeppelin README.md file and will count the number of each words contained in this doc.

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

textfile = spark.read.text(os.environ['ZEPPELIN_HOME'] + "/README.md")
lines = textfile.rdd.map(lambda r: r[0])

counts = lines.flatMap(lambda x: x.split(' ')) \
    .map(lambda x: (x, 1)) \
    .reduceByKey(add)

output = counts.collect()

for (word, count) in output:
    print("%s: %i" % (word, count))
